lignant devil—Yet he even he Mans enemy had
friends & associates, while I am quite alone.
You who call Frankenstein your friend &
seem to have a knowledge of my crimes &
his misfortunes – But in the detail that
he gave of them he could not sum up
the hours & months of misery that I endured
burning with impotent rage – For when

Still I desired love & fellowship and I was still
spurned – Was there no injustice in this? And
am I the only criminal while all man
kind sinned against me? Why do you not
hate Felix who drove his friend from his door
or the man who would have destroyed
the saviour of his child? Nay they are
virtuous & immalculate beings– While I the
miserable & trapmbled on trap trampeled
on, am the devil an abortion to be spurned & kicked
& hated! Even now my blood boils at
the memory of this injustice –
But it is true ‸ that I am a wretch. I have
murdered the lovely & the helpless. I have
seized the innocent as they slept and grasped
his throat to death who never injured me.
I devoted my creator to misery & have follow
ed him even to his death destruction – You hate
me but your a ‸ b horrence cannot equal
mine for myself–I look on my hands that
executed the deeds I think of the heart that
formed the plans & I loathe myself.
